channel.title: 2019 on Nishadh KA
channel.description: Recent content in 2019 on Nishadh KA

item.title: Random forest emulator for GEOS-Chem model
item.description: Repositry https://github.com/christophkeller/gc-rf gives the codes to try with random forest emulator for GEOS chem model output References: Keller, C. A. and Evans, M. J.: Application of random forest regression to the calculation of gas-phase chemistry within the GEOS-Chem chemistry model v10, Geosci. Model Dev., 12, 1209-1225, https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-12-1209-2019, 2019.

item.title: Gaussian Plume Modelling using Python
item.description: Following tutorials Gaussian Plume Modelling https://personalpages.manchester.ac.uk/staff/paul.connolly/teaching/practicals/gaussian_plume_modelling.html Python based https://github.com/maul1609/gaussian-plume-model-practicals Different method using Monte Carlo dispersion modeling, https://github.com/NumericalEnvironmental/Monte_Carlo_atmospheric_plume using

item.title: Large Eddy Simulation using Julia
item.description: A large Eddy simulation for Oceanic processes, written entirely in Julia https://github.com/climate-machine/Oceananigans.jl

item.title: PUFF- A Lagrangian Trajectory model using Python
item.description: Based on this blog post on PUFF model which uses python to simulate the paper on Lagrangian Trajectory model Searcy, C., K. Dean, W. Stringer (1998), PUFF: a highresolutionvolcanic ash tracking model,J. Volcanol. Geotherm. Res., 80,No. 1/2, 1â€“16, doi:10.1016/S0377-0273(97)00037-1 http://publish.illinois.edu/pillsburydoughcat/puff-model/

item.title: Finding route between two points from OSM road network input
item.description: Finding navigable route such as for driving between two points has several application. Open Street Map(OSM) with its free downloadable map, routing algorithms can be applied to find best route between two location. OSMNX, a python library import osm (a default file format provided by OSM) into graphml format which can be used with network analysis to get route network. The OSM downloaded from overpass using the polygon bouundary for an urban area, the overpass query https://overpass-api.

item.title: Vim commands
item.description: started to use vim for having a multi line indentation, it is not at all having steap learning curve First think to rememeber when in vim- esc/i to make multi line indentation, have to space based instead of tab based set expandtab esc then shift+v then choose the lines then > for space based indentation which is identified by markdown to view the hidden charecters, good for editing markdowns
